productSpecification:
The following features are delivered through the hardware:

     

  • WAN:

    • Embedded Modem Options:
      • LP6 Category 6 LTE Advanced LTE modem (with DC-HSPA+ failover)
      • LP5 Category 6 LTE Advanced LTE modem (with DC-HSPA+ failover)
      • LP4 Category 4 LTE modem (one modem included; dual-modem option) multi-carrier, software-defined radio (includes DC-HSPA+ failover)
      • LPE 4G LTE (one modem included; dual-modem option) modem with multi-carrier, software-defined radio (includes HSPA+/ EVDO/3G and 2G failover)
      • LP3 4G LTE modem (with HSPA+ and 2G failover)
    • 5 10/100/1000 ethernet ports (cable/DSL/T1/satellite/Metro Ethernet; WAN/LAN switchable)
    • WiFi* (as WAN; Metro WiFi) 2×2 MIMO 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz (802.11 a/b/g/n/ac; internal antennas)

  • LAN:

    • Dual-band, dual-concurrent WiFi* (802.11 a/b/g/n/ac)
    • 5 10/100/1000 ethernet ports (WAN/LAN switchable)

  • Temperature:

    • 0 °C to 50 °C (32 °F to 122 °F) operating
    • -20 °C to 70 °C (-4 °F to 158 °F) storage

  • Humidity (non-condensing):

    • 10% to 85% operating
    • 5% to 90% storage

  • Memory:

    • 256 MB DRAM; 16 MB SPI Flash; 256 MB NAND Flash

  • Size:

    • 8.3 × 6.6 × 1.7 in (210 × 167 × 44 mm)
    • 1U height for rack mount

  • Weight:

    • 1 lb 4.4 oz (.58 kg)

  • Certifications:

    • FCC, WiFi Alliance, CE, IC, carrier certifications

  • WIFI Power (FCC):

    • 2402-2483.5 MHz (2.4 GHz band): 28.51 dBm conducted
    • 5150-5250 MHz (5 GHz band 1): 26.66 dBm conducted
    • 5725-5850 MHz (5 GHz band 3): 23.54 dBm conducted

  • WIFI Power (Europe/Rest of World):

    • 2.4 GHz band: 19.95 dBm EIRP
    • 5150-5250 MHz: 22.98 dBm EIRP

  • Power Consumption(Typical)

    • AER1600
      • Idle: 9.5 W
      • Single Modem: 13.1 W
      • Dual Modem: 15.2 W
    • AER1650
      • Idle: 7.3 W
      • Single Modem: 8.6 W
      • Dual Modem: 10.6 W

  • WARNING: Using a power adapter other than the one provided may damage the device and will void the warranty.

packagecontents.text: (1) AER1600 Series router with embedded LTE (LP4) modem

getConnect:
Connect a Wired WAN

  1. Connect the provided Ethernet cable to the WAN port on the router. Connect the other end to your WAN source. (Port WAN is default WAN. All ports are LAN/WAN switchable).
insertSim:
Insert activated SIM cards

  1. Turn the router over and remove the SIM door screw (if present)
  1. Open the SIM door

  1. Unlock SIM-1 slot and flip it to the open position.
  1. Slide an activated 2FF-sized SIM card into the slot. Contacts up. Notch up.
  1. Flip SIM-1 down and lock it.


  1. Repeat for SIM-2 if needed.
  1. Close the SIM door and secure with the SIM door screw.


Insert external MC400 Modem (optional)

  1. Insert an activated 2FF-sized SIM card into the MC400 modem.
  2. Remove the modem door (check bottom of the device for presence of the modem door screw)

  1. Insert the MC400 modem. USB port in. Cradlepoint logo up.



  1. Replace the MC400 modem door and secure with the modem door screw (under the device).



    • NOTE: Remove plastic SMA covers on the modem door to expose port openings (MC400-600M only)
attachCellularAntenna:
Attach the 4G LTE antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular antennas to the connectors.

  2. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base to thread onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  3. Angle the antennas based on the diagram below.

Attach MC400 4G LTE antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular modem antennas to the connectors.



  2. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base to thread onto the device. The maximum recommended torque is 4 in-lbs (typically this is “finger tight”).
  3. Angle the antennas based on the diagrams below.
poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Connect the power supply to the router and then plug the other end into an electrical outlet.
  2. Switch the device to ON (O = OFF, – = ON). The LED lights will begin lighting up.
